contest-event.event-date:
Oct. 6, 1900 D Royal South Street Eisteddfod (A Grade)
Royal South Street Eisteddfod (A Grade) 10 Other Royal South Street Eisteddfod royal-south-street-eisteddfod
A Grade
Set Test and Own Choice
Ballarat Oval, Ballarat, Victoria, Australia INTRODUCTION of Brass Band Contest The Royal South Street Society added a Brass Band section to the program of events
The contest was billed as the Grand Intercolonial Band Contest (Ungraded ) with the following conditions Reed Instruments permitted (3rd Battalion Launceston only band to include reed instruments) No Drums or Cymbals No less than 16 or more that 24 players Each band to play 2 selections or 1 selection & 1 overture The winners were decided on the total aggregate points of the 2 selections
9 bands competed-- 7 from Victoria - 1 each from Tasmania and N S W
A Quickstep Diagram March was held on Sunday 7th.
15,000 people thronged the City Oval for the closing scene.
No.1 Selection points listed under Test No.2 Selection points listed under Own Choice
June 7, 2016, 11:38 p.m. April 21, 2020, 12:19 p.m.
1 Lord Nelson Mine Band Anthony Grieve Rossini's Works
2 Bathurst District Samuel Lewins Reminiscences of Weber
3 Prout's (Ballarat) Arthur Prout Lucia di Lammermoor [unknown arranger]
4 Launceston Garrison George Harrison Selection From Great Masters
4 Eaglehawk Citizens Band George Brinkman Reminiscences of Weber
